body.p: State of Kentucky, Franklin Co., sct:

Whereas Alexander Burk stands indicted for the crime of murder, committed by cutting and disemboweling his own father-in-law, Thomas Wallace, without provocation, in Franklin County: and whereas it is represented to me, and I so believe, that this was a very wantin and aggrevated murder, and that said murdered has fled from Justice, and is now running at large in the State of Indiana:

I, Jacob Swigert, Presiding Judge up the Franklin county Court, do hereby Petition and request His Excellency, the present Governor of Kentucky, to offer a reward not exceeding $500, for the apprehension of said murderer.
Given under my hand at Frankfort, Ky., this 18th day of Dec., 1863.

J. Swigert presiding
Judge of Franklin cty:

Petition of
County Judge of Franklin Co.

A reward of $250.00, is offered for the apprehension and delivery, of A Burk to the Jailor, of Franklin County,
Dec 18th 1863
